intro: Phyllanthus gneissicus var. broumoiriensis, commonly known as the Broumoiriensis phyllanthus, is a rare shrub native to specific regions of Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant thrives in rocky, arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh conditions. Its botanical features include glandular hairs on the foliage and a unique seed structure. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
